remarks: The map of a span equals the dual span of some vector (functional). (Contributed by NM, 15-Mar-2015.)
statement:
mapdspex.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
mapdspex.m $e |- M = ( ( mapd ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdspex.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdspex.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
mapdspex.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
mapdspex.c $e |- C = ( ( LCDual ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdspex.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
mapdspex.j $e |- J = ( LSpan ` C ) $.
mapdspex.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
mapdspex.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
mapdspex $p |- ( ph -> E. g e. B ( M ` ( N ` { X } ) ) = ( J ` { g } ) ) $.
$d B g $.
$d C g $.
$d J g $.
$d M g $.
$d N g $.
$d X g $.
